Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class DevelopmentCardSet

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.DevelopmentCardSet
Direct Known Subclasses:
DevelopmentCardSetStub, DevelopmentCardSetStub1
public class DevelopmentCardSet
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the set of development cards that can be bought in the current game. The set is formed by 12 decks. and cards are grouped by color and level.

  • Method Details

    • getAvailableDevelopmentCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Stack<DevelopmentCard>>> getAvailableDevelopmentCards()
      this method returns all the cards that can be bought.
      Returns:
      a matrix of stacks: the first index orders stacks by level(level 1[0], level2[1], level3[2]), while second index orders stacks by color. Colors are ordered following the indexes imposed by the Color enumeration.

    • peekCard

      public DevelopmentCard peekCard​(Color color, int level) throws WrongLevelException, NoCardException
      Select a deck by color and level, and check what's the card on top. Pay attention the development card selected will not be removed by its own stack.
      Parameters:
      color - color of the cards belonging to the deck.
      level - of the cards belonging to the deck.
      Returns:
      the development card which has the color and level specified from the top of its own deck.
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException - if level isn't between 1 and 3.
      NoCardException - if there are no more cards that have the specified color and level.

    • drawCard

      public DevelopmentCard drawCard​(Color color, int level) throws WrongLevelException, NoCardException
      Select a deck by color and level, and remove the card on top.
      Parameters:
      color - color of the cards belonging to the deck.
      level - of the cards belonging to the deck.
      Returns:
      the development card on top of the selected deck.
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException - if level isn't between 1 and 3.
      NoCardException - if the selected deck is empty.

    • getAvailableQuantity

      public int getAvailableQuantity​(Color color, int level) throws WrongLevelException
      Parameters:
      color - of the cards belonging to the deck
      level - of the cards belonging to the deck
      Returns:
      the number of cards inside to the specified deck
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException - if level is less than 1 or level is greater than 3

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe​(VirtualView virtualView)

    • isAColorMissing

      public boolean isAColorMissing()
      checks if there are no more cards of the same color available.
      Returns:
      true if there are no more cards of the same color, otherwise returns false.
